roundDescription: (8 points) It's the 168th anniversary of the first ringing of Big Ben, so in its honor it's a radically roisterous round full of alliterative aural answers.

questions.questionText: Gene Wilder and Timoth√©e Chalamet have both belted out "Pure Imagination" while in character as what chief of chocolate?
If your stereo system is on the fritz you can call the Geek Squad, the IT help team owned by what big box retailer?
Sending ultrahigh frequency waves, a "sonic cannon" was a weapon designed by what fictional billionaire baron and sneaky Superman villain?
Apple Music subscribers stream free on flights with what U.S. carrier that flies more passengers than any other?
On "Carpool Karaoke," Snoop Dogg cruised around in a Lincoln belting out "On The Road Again" with what actor whose singing voice is alright-alright-alright?
Karlie Kloss and Cindy Crawford were just two of the great guest gals who appeared in T. Swift's music video for what song about Band-Aids not fixing bullet holes?
What line of pricey British SUVs brags about their sound systems from pricey British audiophile agency Meridian?
In 006, the Best Sound Editing AND Sound Mixing Oscars both went to what primate picture that Peter Jackson somehow thought deserved to be 187 minutes long?
Bonus: Along with Big Ben, Hampstead Heath, Kings Cross, and the Maritime Museum are some of the other alliterative attractions you can visit in what massive, moist metropolis?
